channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Some ant architects design a colony to cut the risk of disease. Humans, take note!
item.description: One kind of tiny ant can serve as a monumental example for how to keep members of a community safe from pathogens. A new study shows how they do it.
item.content:encoded: One kind of tiny ant can serve as a monumental example for how to keep members of a community safe from pathogens. A new study shows how they do it.
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Shutdown to impact federal workers' pay. And, tensions grow between U.S. and Colombia
item.description: Some federal employees may not receive a paycheck this Friday due to the government shutdown. And, tensions between Colombia and the U.S. continue to rise as the respective leaders clash.
item.content:encoded:
Some federal employees may not receive a paycheck this Friday due to the government shutdown. And, tensions between Colombia and the U.S. continue to rise as the respective leaders clash.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: A theory why the internet is going down the toilet
item.description: A new book diagnoses a sickness affecting some of America's biggest companies.
item.content:encoded: A new book diagnoses a sickness affecting some of America's biggest companies.
item.dc:creator: Greg Rosalsky

item.title: Blue New Jersey is expecting a very close race for governor this November
item.description: President Trump and former President Obama have endorsed the two candidates locked in a tight race for New Jersey governor, Republican Jack Ciattarelli and Democrat Mikie Sherrill.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump and former President Obama have endorsed the two candidates locked in a tight race for New Jersey governor, Republican Jack Ciattarelli and Democrat Mikie Sherrill.

(Image credit: Heather Khalifa)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: 'Cancer doesn't care': Patients pushed past divisive politics to lobby Congress
item.description: Hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer. The advocacy came just before the stalemate that has shut down the federal government.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of volunteer advocates put partisan differences aside and pressed Congress to help people with cancer. The advocacy came just before the stalemate that has shut down the federal government.

(Image credit: Charlotte Kesl for KFF Health News)
item.dc:creator: Noam Levey

item.title: Karine Jean-Pierre on why she left the Democrats â€” and calls herself independent
item.description: In her new book Independent, former Biden press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre writes that party infighting, bias and disloyalty drove her to leave the Democratic Party.
item.content:encoded:
In her new book Independent, former Biden press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre writes that party infighting, bias and disloyalty drove her to leave the Democratic Party.

(Image credit: Bronson Arcuri/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Majd Al-Waheidi

item.title: Middle East Institute's Natan Sachs on Israel and the future of the ceasefire deal
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Natan Sachs with the Middle East Institute about the future of the ceasefire deal from Israel's perspective.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with Natan Sachs with the Middle East Institute about the future of the ceasefire deal from Israel's perspective.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Japan's parliament elects Sanae Takaichi as nation's first female prime minister
item.description: Japan's parliament elected Sanae Takaichi as the country's first female prime minister Tuesday, after her party struck a coalition deal expected to pull her governing bloc further to the right.
item.content:encoded:
Japan's parliament elected Sanae Takaichi as the country's first female prime minister Tuesday, after her party struck a coalition deal expected to pull her governing bloc further to the right.

(Image credit: Eugene Hoshiko)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: American chess grandmaster Daniel Naroditsky dies at 29
item.description: The Charlotte Chess Center, where Naroditsky trained and worked as a coach, announced his death, calling him "a talented chess player, educator, and beloved member of the chess community."
item.content:encoded:
The Charlotte Chess Center, where Naroditsky trained and worked as a coach, announced his death, calling him "a talented chess player, educator, and beloved member of the chess community."

(Image credit: Kelly Centrelli/Charlotte Chess Center)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Miami Beach puts the art in offshore artificial reef
item.description: The artificial reef off Miami Beach will be at the same time an art installation, a restoration of the island's coral habitat and an underwater tourist attraction.
item.content:encoded:
The artificial reef off Miami Beach will be at the same time an art installation, a restoration of the island's coral habitat and an underwater tourist attraction.

(Image credit: Courtesy of the Reefline)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen
